website_summaries.verdict: A good budget or beginner fat tire bike that will not break the bank to deliver a smooth ride.
pros: Tires are fairly resistant to small scratches and punctures, which often occurs on rough trails
Seat has a good amount of adjustability for personalizing the fit of the bike
cons: The shifting can be far from smooth and requires extra force, notably in the middle gears

website_summaries.verdict: A rugged bike that stands out for its fat tires and ability to ride over various terrain. However, those who are looking for speed and a lighter build should consider others on our shortlist.
pros: Features a rugged cruiser frame with four-inch-wide knobby tires for easy handling over rough and bumpy terrain
Earns praise from heavier owners who say it accommodates their weight nicely
cons: On the heavy side, which makes it difficult to maneuver for some

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Bike; Thin Saddle
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this bike! I am a hefty dude who's trying to lose weight. So, it could be due to my "fattitude," but the OG saddle rode up my bum and squished my jubblies. Thus, I had to find a saddle with more than a little padding to help keep my family jewels and backdoor intact and healthy. Other than that, the Mongoose Fat Tire bike is amazing for this fat guy! I am hoping to not be as fat, soon, as this Mongoose makes riding FUN!
customer_reviews.author: John Richard Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Heavy fun!
customer_reviews.text: It's a heavy beast. That being said it's a lot of fun to ride on trail and as a bar cruiser. A couple of cheap upgrades like a Shimano Mega Range freewheel and a quick fire shifter made it much more pleasurable to ride.
customer_reviews.author: C.W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it would buy again if the cycle repeated itself
customer_reviews.text: Very Fun fat tire bike for tooling around the neighborhood and for taking in the mud and snow. It is surely not as capable as a Surly or similar purpose built bike but I didn't want to break the bank either so I am very happy with this purchase for a 62 Y.O. intermediate experience mountain biker. I bought one of their earlier single speed beasts and had to put a gear cassette package and low ratio sprocket on it so this one with seven speeds was a welcome change
customer_reviews.author: purplehays

customer_reviews.title: The picture is not what you get.
customer_reviews.text: I have not started to assemble yet. But out of the box I am disappointed. The rims for the bike are not the same as shown. I did not buy the other mongoose fat tire bike because of the rim design. I do not like the exposed tube look. I liked the look of a solid non-perforated rim. I was expecting the solid rim. Why only one star? Because the rims were a huge factor in my decision. And I was expecting to get the bike depicted in the photos.
customer_reviews.author: C T Rlow

customer_reviews.title: ... it for the beach in Florida and it worked great!. With the 4" wide tires
customer_reviews.text: We bought it for the beach in Florida and it worked great!. With the 4" wide tires, it will go thru any loose, soft sand. Other people on "mountain" bike tires (~2" wide) and "Plus" size (~#" wide) would bog down even in the harder sand toward the surf. These could be ridden up thru the loose sand thru the dunes without digging in. The only negative is - this is a heavy bike (~50 lbs.) so I wouldn't want to ride any mountains with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dom Tomac

customer_reviews.title: You're paying for a budget entry level bike.
customer_reviews.text: Garbage brake levers. Where the brake line screws into the lever assembly it's basically plastic on plastic. My 2nd ride on this bike after adjusting the brakes the barrel popped out and it now won't thread in. I ordered some metal levers to replace the garbage it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: GingerMan512

customer_reviews.title: My every day bike.
customer_reviews.text: I did a 2wd ebike conversion with it. The best ebike I ever built! It comes with garbage rims so I just ordered new f&r 1000w motor kits to replace them. Paint had some scratches from the packaging meant to protect it. Would of been better off if they did nothing. Box came opened from UPS. Other than the two motor kits to replace the scratched up cheap wheels, I replaced bars, stem, breaks to hydraulic, Thumb shifter, grips, and added a megarange freewheel.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews prior to my purchase, they were mixed. I've had the bike for one month at this point and have had no issues. It's heavy duty and very stable. I've received a ton of compliments on its appearance. Very satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: cooks well

customer_reviews.title: A bargain offer and a bargain response
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price. There are a few things that will wear out quickly and one that is a real PIA (that seat). I know little about bikes but can detect quality and value differences. You will not be buying an heirloom but the fat tires do offer a cushioned ride. It is heavy. The local bike shop guy told me it won't last a year. At that price, including a few upgrades, and at my age, I might not last a year either. I am satisfied with my purchase- I have gotten what I'd paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Pigasus

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I decided to take up cycling again and in my research, this was the best option for me. I weigh in excess of 350 pounds so I needed something heavy duty that would support my weight. I have ridden a couple of times now since receiving the bike and it is a blast. I wish it has more speeds to choose from but it works for now.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Powers

customer_reviews.title: Great starter fat tire bike
customer_reviews.text: The bike is very sturdy and rides real well. This is my first fat tire bike and I am having a ball with it. I live in Wisconsin and have ridden it about every day this winter and is fun to ride in the snow and up snow banks.
customer_reviews.author: flymutt

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike. Hard to believe it's so inexpensive. Even though it's a mountain bike, it's awesome on the street. Just get yourself a large gel seat. Great bike for getting some exercise around the neighborhood. To make sure it was setup right and greased properly, I took it boxed to a local bike shop and paid them to do it. A few weeks later I ordered taller handlebars so I wasn't constantly leaning forward like a mountain bike. Now it's as comfortable around the neighborhood as a classic Earth Cruiser.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Davis

customer_reviews.title: Pedal hole is stripped
customer_reviews.text: Bicycle was easy to put together however after putting it together I went to put the right pedal on and the hole is stripped or not drilled properly. I can't review any futher because I can't ride it. Sucks because I needed it this weekend. I know some people will think I stripped it however that is unlikely since I was just hand tightening it and could never get even 1 thread to take hold. Update. Called mongoose and they offered to fix the problem. Also called Amazon and they offered to fix the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bike. Easy assembly. Chain is a PoS.
customer_reviews.text: *Buy a new chain* Or find a different bike? Bike works fine out if the box (Except for chain). Easy to assemble. There's a lot of people reviewing they do upgrades right away. Those upgrades aren't necessarily mandatory, although, three things will immediately provide a smoother, more effortless ride: Re-Grease axles, swap out the flywheel, buy a stronger chan. And if all you have are tools and low friction grease- Axles are 50% of what feels like if sluggish. Seems like they used cosmoline as the Lubricant. Chain legitimately threw a link off pedaling up the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Myles B Dyson

customer_reviews.title: Big Bike for Big Guys
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bike. I am a larger man and when I say large I mean FAT... at 6' 1" and 385 lbs I have no trouble with this bike holding my weight. after a few modifications I am able to ride on the street or on the trails with comfort and ease. The only complaint is the shifter. I have larger hands and found myself constantly changing gears with the grip shifter. I changed it to a traditional gear shifter and it makes my riding much easier. get a big seat as well.... see you on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: P Stahl

customer_reviews.title: You need this bike.
customer_reviews.text: railroad tracks? Check. Sand? Check. Water? Check. Mud? Check. Pavement with pebbles? Check. Ultimate fun with family? Check. Stupid grin on face, check. Worth every penny and minute.
customer_reviews.author: openshaw_5

customer_reviews.title: Big bike with a tiny little seat
customer_reviews.text: Just took this badboy out for a ride. Nice and smooth ride and easy to maneuver. Assembly was very easy as well. I'm a big, fat guy and the seat was going places I don't believe it was designed to go. It's a very narrow seat for such a large bike. I'll have to buy a different seat, but that's not Mongooses fault. So far I am very satisfied with this product. My taint is a little upset though.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Do it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a great product! the Chinese are wonderful people! Assembly took about an hour, or for those statisticians out there, about four beers. Easily assembled, minor adjustments on the brakes. Two tenths of a mile from the beach in Florida, I lubricated everything during assembly and then some. Took it to the beach on the fith beer and was quite impressed! I'm obviously quite the novice, but this bicycle surpassed all my expectations. Well worth the hard earned money! My only upgrade would be a fat cushy seat!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a birthday gift for my husband. I'd been looking for one of these for a while now and was excited to find this bike with the perfect color and great reviews. When we started unwrapping the parts we noticed the steel frame was bent so badly the 6/7 shimano part hits the tire rim. Screws weren't even correctly. We didn't bother unwrapping anything else, no fixing that, or at least we shouldn't have to for something that was purchased new. Either badly made or we got someone else's return. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Nice build easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: First fat tire, I’ve wanted one for a while. Easy assembly, good build, stout bike! I still need to figure out how to adjust handlebar height but rides nice no rubs or alignment issues. A few blemishes from shipping but it’s going to happen over time/use. I would recommend this bike to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: misterZ

customer_reviews.title: This is definitely a "go anywhere, do anything" bike!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected, and more! It's an "entry level" fat tire bike, with budget conscious consumers in mind. It performs EXACTLY how you'd expect, and if you want to customize it, the parts are universal and readily available to tailor this to your exact riding style... Grass, sand, mud, steep terrain? ALL handled with ease! Took it up the local hills after a couple gearing changes and I'm really impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Torgersen (R1-Squirrel)

customer_reviews.title: Great beach bike at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it for the money. Replaced single speed Mongoose Fat Tire which was just too heavy and difficult for beach riding. For the $50 difference totally go for the Malus, lighter and the gears make a huge difference. Still use the single speed on pavement, but if you are looking to do beach riding, this is your bike in this price range. Just remember, it is a $240 not $1,240 bike. Does the trick, lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kroll

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: It was missing 2 clamp screws (M5x8) upon arrival so a trip to Home Depot was needed, It was well packaged, went together without any issues. As others have said, it needs a good seat, and other upgrades, to make it really great. But for now it just needs some breaking in. I transferred some parts from my old bike (seat, pedals) for now so I can ride it in comfort. Good value for the money. I was surprised and pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Packaging Ever! GREAT Bike!!
customer_reviews.text: The best packaged item I’ve ever bought. It came the day that I was going to cancel it. The bike rides great, like peddling a 45 Harley...lol. It came complete with tools & assembly instructions. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Moral & Ethics Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery, great bike, very good value!
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery & great bike. Mostly preassembled and super easy to complete assembly with good instructions. Fun bike to ride and overall very good quality and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Alu

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. Took me about 25 minutes to assemble. The only issue I have is with the gears. The timing on the gears is delayed when you change them – sometimes it takes 5 to 10 seconds for them to change. Other than that, I really like the bike. Rides well and conquers some tough trails. I’m not a serious rider, so this bike is perfect for me. I’m 6’ tall and have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: TMcCann

customer_reviews.title: I like it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The bike arrived today, I read numerous reviews about how horrible the delivery was and lots of damage etc. When I bought it, stated it would take 4 to 5 days with prime, I ordered it March 31st, I received it today, April 10th, so shipping was a bit slow, only damage I've noticed so far it some pretty nasty scratches on the front rim. I have not yet ridden it because I've Bern busy today installing upgrades like pedals, rapid shifter, grips, seat etc. The bike looks awesome, I can't wait to get out and ride, I will be upgrading the freewheel next for sure.
customer_reviews.author: michael barrington

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike, it goes everywhere, easy to assemble for people who have basic skills. The bike rides and shifts smooth, I did change the seat to the Cloud 9 seat, I like a bigger comfortable seat. This is a great value, I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: trp rtd2

customer_reviews.title: Damn good bike
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the bike the only trouble I had was when the front brake was scraping the caliper if I'm saying that right other than that it came perfect it's Switching gears good and everything else is fine you guys will enjoy this bike but if you're going to come be a commute bike person get smaller tires cuz I won't fit on a bus rack
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase but follow advice on reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best bike you'll find at a $200 range. The bike has got killer looks and the it's really well balanced, design wise. People comment everywhere so be prepared to stick out. Parked mine next to a Surly and most people thought my Mongoose was cooler. Owner for 3 months now. Totally pleased with my purchase BUT LISTEN TO ADVICE ON REVIEWS. A Cloud 9 seat is mandatory as is replacing the twist grip shifter to a quickfire Shimano. Grease EVERYTHING inc bearings. And there you go, you'll have an awesome go-to fat bike. I can't even get back on a normal mountain bike now, feels unstable, flimsy and just plain boring.
customer_reviews.author: jesse heitman-seel

customer_reviews.title: Very Large Dudes this is the bike for you
customer_reviews.text: Im 6'4" 440 lbs and this thing is a tank. If you were like me looking for a bike for excercise but concerned at the cost vs how long it will hold up this is a safe bet.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Christie

customer_reviews.title: Good ride. But tube gave way after 7 miles.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took about an hour since pre-assembled. I have the Aztec too and this one is a bit lighter than that. I think its the Aztec frame. Did some minor adjustment on limiter on derailleur after test riding it. Bad sides so far riding on road (not even off-road): (1) Only less than 10 miles (around 7 miles) and the tube gave way. Not sure yet if there is a puncture. (2) Stock seats are not comfortable. Will replace this soon.
customer_reviews.author: JOEMIL AGANAN

customer_reviews.title: I can't recommend this great bike enough.
customer_reviews.text: This a great bike at great price. Was really easy to assemble once I realized that it had two sets of instructions, one for this model and one for another model. It's a ride great for someone who is 6'2" and 250 plus pounds. First bike I have found that I don't hit my knees on the handle bars. The ride is smooth and the gear shifting is easy and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Camp

customer_reviews.title: Let the fun begin!
customer_reviews.text: Got it a day early, thank you amazon. Love it. Huge tires. The seat leaves something to be desired. Small adjustments, no surprises. This is my new motorized project. Edit; After a new seat 250+ miles, 80cc engine, jackshaft. ... Bike is holding up to 35+ mph, off-roading, a few damaged sidewalks turned into ramps (had me two feet in the air), and all the four foot wide speed bumps all around my city. I've gotten a bit of air on those as well... Mesquite thorns and road debris have been the only issue. The only thing making noise is my left pedal. .
customer_reviews.author: Coyo ZTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight frame,  gigantic wheels
customer_reviews.text: Interesting bike , looks and feels like a cruiser massive wheels light frame simple handle bar. Expensive in my opinion. I still prefer a mountain bike but I guess this is the new generation of bikes. Easy to assemble and nice easy ride.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great for lower back problems.
customer_reviews.text: After a new seat, this bike is great. Had to inflate the tires a bit for road riding and learn how to adjust the disc brakes to get them tuned just right, but I would expect to have to do that with any bike. Definitely more work to move this bike than the standard mountain bike. I have lower back issues and bought this bike as the ride was supposed to be smoother than a suspension bike. It DEFINITELY IS. Highly recommend. Lost a star for the seat replacement. New seat:
customer_reviews.author: BuyinShite

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is FUN! I have to make some adjustments to the breaks and handles. It came almost all the way assembled. It’s the monster truck of bikes. Fun fun fun. It will definitely strengthen your legs. Don’t do hills on leg day!
customer_reviews.author: Da Man

customer_reviews.title: Bike is worth the price compared to units which cost up to 25 time more!
customer_reviews.text: Bike is ok. I replaced several items on the bike, for the price works great compared to a bike that costs $2,000. The weight after replacing components was under 40 pounds. Worth the money whether using it heavily for recreation or occasionally during the winter
customer_reviews.author: Ed the Pilot

customer_reviews.title: I was good to go
customer_reviews.text: Got the bike when promised. after some minor assembly, I was good to go. took it out on 1st trip. (about 5 miles). very easy to handle, however the seat could be a little more comfortable. Felt pretty saddle sore after my ride. I will upgrade to something more comfortable. Does fit my body size. Short guy, 5-5 and 210 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: A very fun and strong bike perfect for a rural area as ...
customer_reviews.text: A very fun and strong bike, perfect for a rural area as West Texas. However, as other reviews mention, has some cheap parts in between the good ones, almost details that make a difference. Nothing to compare with a Trek, for the price and quallity. Easy to assemble, I'm not a fan of the front disc brake, but is needed for sure, and after riding for a while, it will adjust more..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but loads of fun. Keep the tier pressure low and it's a ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a large 11 year old, would work for a standard 13-14 yo. Not a fast bike, will not win any races, but loads of fun. Keep the tier pressure low and it's a blast. just seems to float over soft surfaces, and rough ground. Assembly was easy, but it would help if you had a very thin 15mm wrench to attach the peddles, and adjusting the breaks will take a few minutes at least, but that is true with any disc brake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good value, but needs some minor modifications
customer_reviews.text: The bike it’s self is a good value and fun to ride. It was easy to assemble and it rides fairly smooth. My only concerns were the seat was absolutely horrible, so I replaced it. The gear shifter is not that great so I replaced it. The breaks are also less than ideal, so I am in the process of changing those. Still, I don’t regret buying it because it’s an excellent entry level fat tire bike.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very securely packed.
customer_reviews.text: This bike is very impressive, easy to complete assembly as it was pre assembled and adjusted, then front wheel removed for packing an handlebars rotated, minor tweaking of disk brakes, shoes and no disk rubbing, at all, smooth!! Much easier to pedal than I anticipated, even up hill, and seat went up high enough for my 32 inch in seam.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: New found fun for us geezers.
customer_reviews.text: Certainly, at 46 pounds, don't expect to win the uphill race. What would you expect for a dirt cheap fat bike? What you get is dependable Shimano shifting, and a waaay cool ride. The bike turns heads, and is a joy to own. You feel strong, the girth translates to smoothness, and lots of fun. As a former bike mechanic, and retired shop manager, I am astounded at what a meager 210ish bucks can buy. This will take you where your road bike can't, and can handle almost any terrain. I had given up mountain biking for the road years ago, but guess what? I'LL BE BACK!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J Kearns

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BIKE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!!! When I got it as a gift from my wife seven weeks ago I was 6'2", 352 lbs. The bike held up under me very, very well over any terrain. I'm down 53 lbs so far and racking up the miles. Great bike!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Wood

customer_reviews.title: I've had it now for over 2 years, ride ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had it now for over 2 years, ride it ~15 miles round trip a couple times a month. It has held up really well. I haven't changed any of the components yet, but I am looking to upgrade as numerous reviews mention (bearings, freewheel, shifter and grips). I'm surprised how well the tires have held up and hold pressure. I've adjusted the brakes a couple times and they seem sub-par, but still work. No regrets and for the price no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike it's a beginner electric bike for me I plan to put a kit on it I also bought the Shimano gear kit even though every other part of the gear system says Shimano the actual gears are not but for the price it was a excellent deal and 15 dollars more for the full Shimano kit still really cheap and really easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Mycol

customer_reviews.title: Smooth ride
customer_reviews.text: Came completely intact. Everything was easy to assemble and rides smooth. Took me a couple days to get the brakes adjusted but that was not out of the ordinary. Have received compliments already. I do recommend this bike. Eventually, I plan on a smaller sprocket to get lower gearing and greasing and lubing bottom bracket, etc. But will be a fun project adding improvements one month at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to get into a Fat Tire bike but not willing to part with $1000-$3000 — this bike was perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: For $260 - a can’t miss bike. Wanted to get into a Fat Tire bike but not willing to part with $1000-$3000 — this bike was perfect for me. I am 6’3 - 245lbs and fit perfect on it (19” bike)
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Scratched paint
customer_reviews.text: Received my new bike without incident, put it together etc. Only 1 issue that I can share. The frame came with severe paint scratches on the top tube and down tube where the seat attaches. The shipping box was in excellent condition so the scratches had to occur when packed! Kinda disappointing but the over all performance was compatible to the price..!....
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: It's what I paid for but have already started swapping ...
customer_reviews.text: It's what I paid for but have already started swapping parts to make it more rideable. Should have gone for a higher end bike since that's what I will end up with all of the upgrades.
customer_reviews.author: richard coelho

customer_reviews.title: this thing is awesome. Assembly is really easy and quick
customer_reviews.text: First off for a $200 bike, this thing is awesome. Assembly is really easy and quick. One thing you have to lube the assembly because it comes with almost none, and the front brake needs adjustment. Very fun to ride and this bike does NOT feel slow, actually picks up very quickly. Im very excited to see what adventures i have in store with this bike. I would definetly switch the turn shifter for trigger shifters
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Good fat tire bke for the money
customer_reviews.text: Overall good fat tire bike for the money. The box arrived fairly beatup, but everything was fine inside. My main complaint would be the quality of the front disk brake, but at this price point it is acceptable. It took a bit to get everything dialed in after a few rides, but it is fun to ride. You get lot's of looks and plenty of exercise on a shorter ride due to the extra friction and contact patch of the tires. Overall I'm happy and take this bike out to ride whenever time permits.
customer_reviews.author: Adam OnTheScene

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike. It's good for tooling around the neighborhood and getting a little exercise in. The fat tires always grab attention when I ride by. I've had no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Kidder

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, buy it assembled!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of bike for the money.. do yourself a favor and have it assembled unless you've got an entire afternoon for assembly and tuning. You'll be balancing front and rear disc brakes as well as tuning the derailleur. Took me over 4hrs and I'm handy with tools, I am not a bike-smith!
customer_reviews.author: Fertram

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is 17 and he is a tall and big guy. It is awesome he has been through trails and rough terrain. This bike is derabal and for the cost a all around great buy. It does have some tire noise when you are on the pavement and the disc brakes are a little challenging to set up .
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: If you are thinking a low budget fat tire force now I have 5 mongoose at house
customer_reviews.text: This bike is nice I have up graded a bit air fork hydraulic brake still need to do crank set I want to be able to do higher gears I have found you head to play with air psi in tires I never go over 15 psi for road 7 to 10 for dirt I can't wait to see what snow is like get rid of twist shifter I order that with bike brake handles need to go to I have to get a hitch for my son now
customer_reviews.author: Lary alan king

customer_reviews.title: Guess I should invest in a woman's bike like it. I'm soon 70 and he 73
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES this bike. The wider tires make his 5 miles trek in am and pm a lot safer as they help the bike glide over stones or a sudden road ledge without throwing him. Guess I should invest in a woman's bike like it. I'm soon 70 and he 73. He says the bike rides have really improved his balance as well as his leg strength.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M. DeVoll

customer_reviews.title: Fat tires
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike looks like a beast with the fat tires , great for the dirt roads.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Gaspar Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: I removed the kickstand and installed a better one. Although this is a 26" bike
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect quality components. I removed the kickstand and installed a better one. Although this is a 26" bike, due to the height of the tires it stands as a 29". The wheel bearings are relatively cheap. Overall I am not surprised, the price is right and I'm just riding it to the beach. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Al Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had my local bike shop do a safety check once it was assembled . Love my new bike !!! It came pre-assembled and wasn't hard to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Love it, you will too!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bike, rides like no other vike i had, fun, got it while on sale, coudnt be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price! Comfortable Ride!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike, smooth ride. I've put this bike on multiple trails since I got it and it has not failed me yet! Excellent product, sturdy frame. I hope I never have to but would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bike!!! Just buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: my Husband loves this bike and was on the road in like 20 min after opening the box. He hasn’t rode a bike in over 20 years and is a big guy and when he hopped on it never missed a beat! Now he’s very excited to ride and hasn’t stopped talking about riding.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Great first fat bike.
customer_reviews.text: This bike is great for the price. I’m a dad that wants to ride with my kids. This bike is perfect for me. I would recommend a few upgrades but it’s well worth the money right out of the box. The rear gear set should have a lower first gear for hills and the seat is too stiff for old butts.
customer_reviews.author: Deejay

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for the brakes came partially ...
customer_reviews.text: you get what you pay for the brakes came partially engaged all the time, adjusting from that to roll without drag means that they are so loose they're useless
customer_reviews.author: DE

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this bike and I took it on a ride. I love the looks of it, it is Black and Silver. However it needs an upgrade in the gear department. 7 speeds just isn't enough for me. Being 6'2 I also need to get some Handle bar risers. A more padded seat won't hurt as well. Overall though it isn't a bad bike for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kristal B.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful incomplete purchase
customer_reviews.text: So I got my bike today we took it to local bike shop to have it professional put together ( I didn't want to risk it). Beautiful bike that came with no pedals and a bent brake disc luky for me they gave me a pair of pedals and he was able to bend the disc back into shape.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Greak bike.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, nice comfortable ride. Downfalls are the seat and gearing. Check out what everyone else bought with they'res and you'll get the idea. I did shimano mega range and gel padded seat. If you like upgrading things, I'd say its a perfect bike for that.
customer_reviews.author: c.willis

customer_reviews.title: Comes partially assembled, but it's very heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Packaged arrived on time. It was easy to assemble (half assembled out of the box). It was very heavy dragging it upstairs. Solid construction, good engineering work. Recommend for an electric conversion, but probably too heavy to realistically use as a pedal bike.
customer_reviews.author: Cory H.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: it's pretty heavy, but I love it. I had to get a different bike rack to make it easier to reach when i put it on the rack. It's the same rack with only 2 bike capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bike, but brake levers suck!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the bike, but it is heavy. Not an issue for the riding I do, but could be for others. The brakes are junk and the internals within the brake levers at the handle bars are coming apart after riding about a dozen times or so. Will need to get replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Rob M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this bike. He likes the ride and the look. It was a great buy for the money
customer_reviews.author: MANDY

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Haven't owned a bike for nearly 10 years and these fat bikes really got me interested in cycling again. Great bike for the price. Comfortable and easy to ride. A little on the heavy side but given the size that's to be expected. I would recommend a nicer seat and taller handlebars if you're looking to ride more upright. The only thing I'm not a fan of is the twist grip shifter. That will get replaced. Brakes are ok but some better brake levers are not a bad upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: ensignricky

customer_reviews.title: Ready for spring/summer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to ride w/ my daughter. No sense in looking standard so I need to stand out. I got this at a steal for $129. Perfect for bunny hopping alligators in south Florida.
customer_reviews.author: ICEMAN

customer_reviews.title: Great beach bike for soft sand!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 bikes...one for my daughter and I and we truly love these bikes. We live at the beach and enjoy riding them on the soft sand and they are great. I totally recommend them...easy to put together and fun to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Allnock

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissapointed!
customer_reviews.text: Missing so many parts, I don’t know where to start. I’ve been riding Mongoose Bikes since I was a Kid and loved them, so disappointed in this one.
customer_reviews.author: PhoenixRising

customer_reviews.title: It’s dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Seller was great but the bike is dangerous! Please spend the money on a better bike! My biggest complaint is the gears. They slip out of gear for apparently no reason. If you value your knees don’t take this bike uphill standing up! For $300 sure but it’s dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Benini

customer_reviews.title: Came mostly preassembled and great price
customer_reviews.text: The ride was good and lots of thumbs up out in public
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shipped damaged
customer_reviews.text: Well like many others great bike but the derailer arm came in bent. Went to a local bike shop for 13.00 replaced it to find out the frame for derailed arm was bent aswell. I straightened it out. Bought a frame bags that actually fit like a glove. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Frank Soliz

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, cool fat bike!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend for his birthday. He absolutely loves it. Tells me at least once a week that it's the best gift he's ever received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tune bike for better ride
customer_reviews.text: Need to be a little knowledgeable bout tuning A Bike....to get best ride out of bike.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Rose Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike is a bit heavy but I love it. Shifting is a bit touchy but easily adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: charles p pollauf

customer_reviews.title: I return the bike, you received it and I have not been refunded.
customer_reviews.text: it did not fit my son. We returned the bike and have never been refunded. Several calls and messages!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Clare Beaudet

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the price. I also have a Malus which is basically the same bike.
customer_reviews.author: Weekend Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend you try one
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ride. I got a Cloud 9 seat and raised the handlebars a little. The ride is great even with the tires at full pressure, 20 lbs. I have been working my way down by 2 lb. increments. It handles and turns great on trails and gives you confidence when going through the woods. There was a lot of talk about it being heavy and hard to pedal. I am 68 and have no problem. It is only .5 lb. heavier than my Raleigh Route 4 hybrid. Looking forward to riding it this winter in the snow and seeing how it handles there.
customer_reviews.author: David Hinz

customer_reviews.title: Fat tire bikes
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this purchase. I love the ease of assembly and riding. Sand beaches, here I come.
customer_reviews.author: P J Lemley

customer_reviews.title: Arrived faster than expected. Does take a lot to ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived faster than expected. Does take a lot to put together/adjust, but worth it!!! I'm 6'4" and 350+ lbs. and I can ride a bike again!
customer_reviews.author: mahael1

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike for every use, concrete , gravel, sand, snow, does everything.
customer_reviews.text: This was the right bike at the right price. Have more expensive bikes but this one is the best of all times. Doesn’t need suspension the 4” thick tires are their own suspension. Very light weight, and super easy to turn into an EBIKE.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bad Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Mongoose Men's Malus Fat Tire Bike Silver
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this bike and gets compliments when other people see it. It performs exactly as he expected it to.
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: Good bike
customer_reviews.text: I revived the wrong color bike .But the bike it self is very good
customer_reviews.author: Antonio bertolini

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fat Tire Back - Nive
customer_reviews.text: The only negative was the packaging. Box came a little ripped with a small chip on the neck next to the handlebars. Other then that it’s all good!
customer_reviews.author: Keith N.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heavy at 50 lbs. But she’s a beast on the beach. Not so agile for rugged trails.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Great Fat Tire
customer_reviews.text: Excellent starter fat tire. Derailer and brakes needed adjustment after assembly. Cheap plastic pedals. Huge fun riding!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: Super cool bike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is the coolest! It arrived today. Took me about 20 minutes to assemble it and I was out the door! I had purchased a better seat based on the reviews and it added to the already cool looks. Rides great! Get this bike!
customer_reviews.author: Francis Alim

customer_reviews.title: Everyone asks about this bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike is nice looking bike for the money I bought a cloud seat the seat it came with was awful uncomfortable mostly ride on the sand
customer_reviews.author: vls

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, some components (crank
customer_reviews.text: Great bike,some components (crank, pedals, grip shifter) are cheap but you can put up with. I disliked the grip shifter so I purchased a Shimano thumb shifter and grips and replaced the grips. As time goes on I will upgrade components.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool ride on a budget !
customer_reviews.text: Prime had it to me within days. A small pencil eraser shaped paint chip is all the damage it had(WINNING !) after its long trek. Will do a few basic upgrades and enjoy it. Sure, it's no Surley but I didn't want that for a new style of biking which I may not like. If a dig it maybe a bike upgrade down the road. 👍🏼😎
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Very fun bike, well packaged with no damage. Requires some set up and adjustment. Bottom bracket needed lube. Installed metal brake levers and trigger shifter. Great bike, great value.
customer_reviews.author: York

customer_reviews.title: good bike for the money and its not that heavy
customer_reviews.text: every thing i wanted in the fat tire bike. i heard a lot of negatives about this bike online, but none of them true. good bike for the money and its not that heavy.
customer_reviews.author: gerald lonski

product_meta.title: Mongoose Malus Fat Tire Bike with 26-Inch Wheels, with Steel Frame, 7-Speed Shimano Drivetrain, and Mechanical Disc Brakes
feature_bullets: Mongoose Supersized beach cruiser 4 1/4" knobby tires
Cruiser design frame with plenty of clearance to conquer any terrain
Alloy 4" wide wheel set with disc brakes
7 speed gearing with Shimano rear derailleur
3 piece cranks and beach cruiser pedals

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
